page.title: 18LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape is pastoral in this old agricultural heartland. Small fields slope gently from North to South , bounded by ancient Cornish hedges,and roll away to a horizon ringed by the high lands of Dartmoor,Bodmin Moor and Hingston Downs which hide the Tamar estuary from view.Coniferous forests are visible Eastwards,copses and orchards lie within the area, and the hedgerows of mixed species make ribbons of colour throughout the year. Spacious farmhouses and outbuildings of local stone with slate roofs are flanked by modern animal units.Many houses date from the 13th. Century,as does St.Sampsons Church at South Hill. Several have original features intact. Manaton farm,built on the site of a monastery,is mentioned in the original Domesday book.
